revised_title: The Lethality and General Action of Echis carinatus Venom
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Herpetology
tldr: The authors examine the lethality and general action of the venom of the Echis carinatus snake, a highly aggressive and venomous serpent found in parts of India, South Asia, and Northern Equatorial Africa. They describe their examination of the venom's effects on various animals, its impact on blood and organs, and compare it with Sepedon venom. The study provides insights into the characteristics of Viperine and Colubrine venoms and their effects on different animals.
